Name: number of duplicate feature instances
Definition: total number of exact duplications of feature instances within the data
Text description: count of all items in the data that are incorrectly extracted with duplicate geometries
Example: Text Description: Features with identical attribution and identical coordinates representing the same real object, for example: two (or more) points collected on top of each other, two (or more) curves collected on top of each other, or two (or more) surfaces collected on top of each other.

Name: number of invalid overlaps of surfaces
Definition: total number of erroneous overlaps within the data
Text description: Which surfaces may overlap and which shall not is application dependent. Not all overlapping surfaces are necessarily erroneous. When reporting this data quality measure, the types of feature classes corresponding to the illegal overlapping surfaces shall be reported as well. See also: https://standards.isotc211.org/19157/-3/1/req/content/qualityMeasure/204
Example: Text Description: Search for surfaces that are not allowed to overlap according to the conceptual schema. In this case, forest and built-up-area are not allowed to overlap

Name: non-compliance rate with respect to the rules of the conceptual schema
Definition: number of items in the dataset that are not compliant with the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of these items supposed to be in the dataset
Text description: The value indicates number of items in the dataset that are not compliant with the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of these items supposed to be in the dataset
Example: Text Description: 0,02 (in a test area there is 227 objects coded as living houses in the dataset but in the universe of discourse there are 231 objects that should be coded as living houses, 4 of them was coded as farm buildings)

Name: value domain non-conformance
Definition: indication of if an item is not in conformance with its value domain
Text description: The value true indicates that an item is not in conformance with its value domain)
Example: Text Description: True – a feature with attribute colour has the value ‘blau’, but it does not exist in the specified value domain: red, green, blue, yellow

Name: physical structure conflicts
Definition: indication that items are stored in conflict with the physical structure of the dataset
Text description: The value true indicates physical structure conflict
Example: Text Description: True (the dataset is stored in wrong file format, a shape file instead of gml)

Name: number of faulty point-curve connections
Definition: number of faulty point-curve connections in the dataset
Text description: A point-curve connection exists where different curves touch. These curves have an intrinsic topological relationship that shall reflect the true constellation. If the point-curve connection contradicts the universe of discourse, the point-curve connection is faulty with respect to this data quality measure. The data quality measure counts the number of errors of this kind.
Example: Text Description: Count the number of wrong curve connections - e.g. two-point curve connections exist where only one should be present, or count all curves with more than the threshold value of 500 vertices (in which system automatically places point-curve based on vertices limitation built into software code where no spatial justification for point-curve exists).

Name: root mean square error of planimetry
Definition: radius of a circle around the given point, in which the true value lies with probability P
Text description: The true values of the observed coordinates X and Y are known as xt and yt. From this the estimator
Key: s =  RMSEP, linear root mean square error of planimetry

Name: time accuracy at 99,8 % significance level
Basic measure: LE99.8 or LE99.8(r), depending on the evaluation procedure
Definition: half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 99,8 %
Text description: The value indicates the probability for the true value of being within a lower and the upper limit of the interval.

Name: misclassification matrix
Definition: matrix that indicates the number of items of class (i) classified as class (j)
Text description:
The misclassification matrix (MCM) is a quadratic matrix with n columns and n rows. n denotes the number of classes under consideration.
MCM (i,j) = [# items of class (i) classified as class (j)]
The diagonal elements of the misclassification matrix contain the correctly classified items, and the off diagonal elements contain the number of misclassification errors.
Parameter:
Name: n
Definition: number of classes under consideration
Value Type: Integer

Name: data product specification passed
Definition: indication that all requirements in the referred data product specification are fulfilled
Text description: The measure will take the  value true if all the requirements in the referred data product specification are fulfilled

Name: data product specification fail count
Definition: number of data product specification requirements that are not fulfilled by the current product/dataset
